catalogue_raissonne: Hagiwara Hideo hanga sakuhin mokuroku 2013, no. 471
description: yellow background with white stripes across lower half; abstract green, white and red shapes in upper half; gray lines and strokes throughout; block of pink vertical stripes in UR corner; backwards letters in UL (CIRC) cut off by white half circle
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
text: In 1968, Hagiwara Hideo elaborated on the use of wild, swirling lines and then began to integrate forms suggestive of the people in his “Circus” and “Clown” series.
title: Circus No. 1
